A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Best Star Wars movie to date. 
Brilliant acting\, beautiful scenes\, lots of tension\, character building and the best of all\, a feeling of going where no one has gone before in this franchise (sorry for the Trek pun\, just watched TNG back-to-back). 
This movie is anything but the safe choice\, and for that I think it's the best of them all. 
Those giving 0-1 stars wanted the safe choice\, too bad. I applaud the director and Disney for daring to take it in an entirely different\, original direction.
By the way\, some of those 0-1 star reviews sound as if the end of the world is nigh. Chill man\, it's just entertainment\, not religion. 

WARNING Spoilers ahead!

Killing Snoke was the greatest twist I've seen in a long a time in any movie. And clearly something diehard fans didn't like\, yikes. Here's the thing: Killing Snoke was like demolishing everything you thought you knew and starting over with an inexperienced Rey on one side and Ren on the other. You got these two new powerhouses and you have no idea how it will turn out. 
Oh\, and the fact that it was Kylo who killed Snoke was the best part of it all\, and felt so right considering he's a Sith. People complaining that it made no sense need to get their head out their asses and realize that he saw an opportunity and grabbed it. Now he's the master. That's the Sith in a nutshell. 
 
Every time I've walked out of the cinema after having watched a Star Wars installment I've been stoked for the next one\, but I also pretty much knew what was going to happen. With this one I have no idea what to expect from the last installment in two years\, and to be honest that's freaking awesome!  That element of surprise\, of not knowing what will happen or how the next chapter will form itself is something I've never experienced with Star Wars. As a fan\, I think that is the strongest part of TLJ. 

This movie could not be any fresher.
